Hebrew: וַיַּקְהֵ֣ל מֹשֶׁ֗ה אֶֽת־כָּל־עֲדַ֛ת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֑ם אֵ֚לֶּה הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה לַעֲשֹׂ֥ת אֹתָֽם׃
Translit: vayyaqhēl mōsheh ʾeth-kol-ʿadhath bənē yisrāʾēl vayyōʾmer ʾalēhem ʾēlleh haddəvārîm ʾasher-tṣivvāh ʾadhōnāi laʿasōth ʾōthām
English: And Moses gathered all the congregation of the children of Israel together, and said unto them, These are the words which the LORD hath commanded, that ye should do them.

Hebrew: שֵׁ֣שֶׁת יָמִים֮ תֵּעָשֶׂ֣ה מְלָאכָה֒ וּבַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י יִהְיֶ֨ה לָכֶ֥ם קֹ֛דֶשׁ שַׁבַּ֥ת שַׁבָּת֖וֹן לַיהוָ֑ה כָּל־הָעֹשֶׂ֥ה ב֛וֹ מְלָאכָ֖ה יוּמָֽת׃
Translit: shēsheth yāmîm tēʿāseh məlāʾkhāh ūvayyōm hasshəvîʿî yihyeh lākhem qōdhesh shabbath shabbāthōn laʾdhōnāi kol-hāʿōseh vō məlāʾkhāh yūmāth
English: Six days shall work be done, but on the seventh day there shall be to you an holy day, a sabbath of rest to the LORD: whosoever doeth work therein shall be put to death.

Hebrew: לֹא־תְבַעֲר֣וּ אֵ֔שׁ בְּכֹ֖ל מֹשְׁבֹֽתֵיכֶ֑ם בְּי֖וֹם הַשַּׁבָּֽת׃
Translit: lōʾ-thəvaʿarū ʾēsh bəkhōl mōshəvōthēkhem bəyōm hasshabbāth
English: Ye shall kindle no fire throughout your habitations upon the sabbath day.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶל־כָּל־עֲדַ֥ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר זֶ֣ה הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer mōsheh ʾel-kol-ʿadhath bənē-yisrāʾēl lēʾmōr zeh haddāvār ʾasher-tṣivvāh ʾadhōnāi lēʾmōr
English: And Moses spake unto all the congregation of the children of Israel, saying, This is the thing which the LORD commanded, saying,

Hebrew: קְח֨וּ מֵֽאִתְּכֶ֤ם תְּרוּמָה֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה כֹּ֚ל נְדִ֣יב לִבּ֔וֹ יְבִיאֶ֕הָ אֵ֖ת תְּרוּמַ֣ת יְהוָ֑ה זָהָ֥ב וָכֶ֖סֶף וּנְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
Translit: qəḥū mēʾittəkhem tərūmāh laʾdhōnāi kōl nədhîv libbō yəvîʾehā ʾēth tərūmath ʾadhōnāi zāhāv vākhesef ūnəḥōsheth
English: Take ye from among you an offering unto the LORD: whosoever is of a willing heart, let him bring it, an offering of the LORD; gold, and silver, and brass,

Hebrew: וּתְכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ וְעִזִּֽים׃
Translit: ūthəkhēleth vəʾargāmān vəthōlaʿath shānî vəshēsh vəʿizzîm
English: And blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen, and goats' hair,

Hebrew: וְעֹרֹ֨ת אֵילִ֧ם מְאָדָּמִ֛ים וְעֹרֹ֥ת תְּחָשִׁ֖ים וַעֲצֵ֥י שִׂטִּֽים׃
Translit: vəʿōrōth ʾēlim məʾoddāmîm vəʿōrōth təḥāshîm vaʿatṣē siṭṭîm
English: And rams' skins dyed red, and badgers' skins, and shittim wood,

Hebrew: וְשֶׁ֖מֶן לַמָּא֑וֹר וּבְשָׂמִים֙ לְשֶׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה וְלִקְטֹ֖רֶת הַסַּמִּֽים׃
Translit: vəshemen lammāʾōr ūvəsāmîm ləshemen hammishḥāh vəliqṭōreth hassammîm
English: And oil for the light, and spices for anointing oil, and for the sweet incense,

Hebrew: וְאַ֨בְנֵי־שֹׁ֔הַם וְאַבְנֵ֖י מִלֻּאִ֑ים לָאֵפ֖וֹד וְלַחֹֽשֶׁן׃
Translit: vəʾavnē-shōham vəʾavnē milluʾîm lāʾēfōdh vəlaḥōshen
English: And onyx stones, and stones to be set for the ephod, and for the breastplate.

Hebrew: וְכָל־חֲכַם־לֵ֖ב בָּכֶ֑ם יָבֹ֣אוּ וְיַעֲשׂ֔וּ אֵ֛ת כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּ֖ה יְהוָֽה׃
Translit: vəkhol-ḥakham-lēv bākhem yāvōʾū vəyaʿasū ʾēth kol-ʾasher tṣivvāh ʾadhōnāi
English: And every wise hearted among you shall come, and make all that the LORD hath commanded;

Hebrew: אֶת־הַ֨מִּשְׁכָּ֔ן אֶֽת־אָהֳל֖וֹ וְאֶת־מִכְסֵ֑הוּ אֶת־קְרָסָיו֙ וְאֶת־קְרָשָׁ֔יו אֶת־בְּרִיחָ֕ו אֶת־עַמֻּדָ֖יו וְאֶת־אֲדָנָֽיו׃
Translit: ʾeth-hammishkān ʾeth-ʾoholō vəʾeth-mikhsēhū ʾeth-qərāsāv vəʾeth-qərāshāv ʾeth-bərîḥāv ʾeth-ʿammudhāv vəʾeth-ʾadhānāv
English: The tabernacle, his tent, and his covering, his taches, and his boards, his bars, his pillars, and his sockets,

Hebrew: אֶת־הָאָרֹ֥ן וְאֶת־בַּדָּ֖יו אֶת־הַכַּפֹּ֑רֶת וְאֵ֖ת פָּרֹ֥כֶת הַמָּסָֽךְ׃
Translit: ʾeth-hāʾārōn vəʾeth-baddāv ʾeth-hakkappōreth vəʾēth pārōkheth hammāsākh
English: The ark, and the staves thereof, with the mercy seat, and the vail of the covering,

Hebrew: אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָ֥ן וְאֶת־בַּדָּ֖יו וְאֶת־כָּל־כֵּלָ֑יו וְאֵ֖ת לֶ֥חֶם הַפָּנִֽים׃
Translit: ʾeth-hasshuləḥān vəʾeth-baddāv vəʾeth-kol-kēlāv vəʾēth leḥem happānîm
English: The table, and his staves, and all his vessels, and the shewbread,

Hebrew: וְאֶת־מְנֹרַ֧ת הַמָּא֛וֹר וְאֶת־כֵּלֶ֖יהָ וְאֶת־נֵרֹתֶ֑יהָ וְאֵ֖ת שֶׁ֥מֶן הַמָּאֽוֹר׃
Translit: vəʾeth-mənōrath hammāʾōr vəʾeth-kēlehā vəʾeth-nērōthehā vəʾēth shemen hammāʾōr
English: The candlestick also for the light, and his furniture, and his lamps, with the oil for the light,

Hebrew: וְאֶת־מִזְבַּ֤ח הַקְּטֹ֨רֶת֙ וְאֶת־בַּדָּ֔יו וְאֵת֙ שֶׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה וְאֵ֖ת קְטֹ֣רֶת הַסַּמִּ֑ים וְאֶת־מָסַ֥ךְ הַפֶּ֖תַח לְפֶ֥תַח הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
Translit: vəʾeth-mizbaḥ haqqəṭōreth vəʾeth-baddāv vəʾēth shemen hammishḥāh vəʾēth qəṭōreth hassammîm vəʾeth-māsakh happethaḥ ləfethaḥ hammishkān
English: And the incense altar, and his staves, and the anointing oil, and the sweet incense, and the hanging for the door at the entering in of the tabernacle,

Hebrew: אֵ֣ת מִזְבַּ֣ח הָעֹלָ֗ה וְאֶת־מִכְבַּ֤ר הַנְּחֹ֨שֶׁת֙ אֲשֶׁר־ל֔וֹ אֶת־בַּדָּ֖יו וְאֶת־כָּל־כֵּלָ֑יו אֶת־הַכִּיֹּ֖ר וְאֶת־כַּנּֽוֹ׃
Translit: ʾēth mizbaḥ hāʿōlāh vəʾeth-mikhbar hannəḥōsheth ʾasher-lō ʾeth-baddāv vəʾeth-kol-kēlāv ʾeth-hakkiyyōr vəʾeth-kannō
English: The altar of burnt offering, with his brasen grate, his staves, and all his vessels, the laver and his foot,

Hebrew: אֵ֚ת קַלְעֵ֣י הֶחָצֵ֔ר אֶת־עַמֻּדָ֖יו וְאֶת־אֲדָנֶ֑יהָ וְאֵ֕ת מָסַ֖ךְ שַׁ֥עַר הֶחָצֵֽר׃
Translit: ʾēth qalʿē heḥātṣēr ʾeth-ʿammudhāv vəʾeth-ʾadhānehā vəʾēth māsakh shaʿar heḥātṣēr
English: The hangings of the court, his pillars, and their sockets, and the hanging for the door of the court,

Hebrew: אֶת־יִתְדֹ֧ת הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ן וְאֶת־יִתְדֹ֥ת הֶחָצֵ֖ר וְאֶת־מֵיתְרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translit: ʾeth-yithdhōth hammishkān vəʾeth-yithdhōth heḥātṣēr vəʾeth-mēthərēhem
English: The pins of the tabernacle, and the pins of the court, and their cords,

Hebrew: אֶת־בִּגְדֵ֥י הַשְּׂרָ֖ד לְשָׁרֵ֣ת בַּקֹּ֑דֶשׁ אֶת־בִּגְדֵ֤י הַקֹּ֨דֶשׁ֙ לְאַהֲרֹ֣ן הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְאֶת־בִּגְדֵ֥י בָנָ֖יו לְכַהֵֽן׃
Translit: ʾeth-bighdhē hassərādh ləshārēth baqqōdhesh ʾeth-bighdhē haqqōdhesh ləʾaharōn hakkōhēn vəʾeth-bighdhē vānāv ləkhahēn
English: The cloths of service, to do service in the holy place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, to minister in the priest's office.

Hebrew: וַיֵּֽצְא֛וּ כָּל־עֲדַ֥ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִלִּפְנֵ֥י מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translit: vayyētṣəʾū kol-ʿadhath bənē-yisrāʾēl millifnē mōsheh
English: And all the congregation of the children of Israel departed from the presence of Moses.

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֕אוּ כָּל־אִ֖ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־נְשָׂא֣וֹ לִבּ֑וֹ וְכֹ֡ל אֲשֶׁר֩ נָדְבָ֨ה רוּח֜וֹ אֹת֗וֹ הֵ֠בִיאוּ אֶת־תְּרוּמַ֨ת יְהוָ֜ה לִמְלֶ֨אכֶת אֹ֤הֶל מוֹעֵד֙ וּלְכָל־עֲבֹ֣דָת֔וֹ וּלְבִגְדֵ֖י הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
Translit: vayyāvōʾū kol-ʾîsh ʾasher-nəsāʾō libbō vəkhōl ʾasher nādhəvāh rūḥō ʾōthō hēvîʾū ʾeth-tərūmath ʾadhōnāi limleʾkheth ʾōhel mōʿēdh ūləkhol-ʿavōdhāthō ūləvighdhē haqqōdhesh
English: And they came, every one whose heart stirred him up, and every one whom his spirit made willing, and they brought the LORD'S offering to the work of the tabernacle of the congregation, and for all his service, and for the holy garments.

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים עַל־הַנָּשִׁ֑ים כֹּ֣ל נְדִ֣יב לֵ֗ב הֵ֠בִיאוּ חָ֣ח וָנֶ֜זֶם וְטַבַּ֤עַת וְכוּמָז֙ כָּל־כְּלִ֣י זָהָ֔ב וְכָל־אִ֕ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֵנִ֛יף תְּנוּפַ֥ת זָהָ֖ב לַיהוָֽה׃
Translit: vayyāvōʾū hāʾanāshîm ʿal-hannāshîm kōl nədhîv lēv hēvîʾū ḥāḥ vānezem vəṭabbaʿath vəkhūmāz kol-kəlî zāhāv vəkhol-ʾîsh ʾasher hēnîf tənūfath zāhāv laʾdhōnāi
English: And they came, both men and women, as many as were willing hearted, and brought bracelets, and earrings, and rings, and tablets, all jewels of gold: and every man that offered offered an offering of gold unto the LORD.

Hebrew: וְכָל־אִ֞ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־נִמְצָ֣א אִתּ֗וֹ תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֣שׁ וְעִזִּ֑ים וְעֹרֹ֨ת אֵילִ֧ם מְאָדָּמִ֛ים וְעֹרֹ֥ת תְּחָשִׁ֖ים הֵבִֽיאוּ׃
Translit: vəkhol-ʾîsh ʾasher-nimtṣāʾ ʾittō təkhēleth vəʾargāmān vəthōlaʿath shānî vəshēsh vəʿizzîm vəʿōrōth ʾēlim məʾoddāmîm vəʿōrōth təḥāshîm hēvîʾū
English: And every man, with whom was found blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen, and goats' hair, and red skins of rams, and badgers' skins, brought them.

Hebrew: כָּל־מֵרִ֗ים תְּר֤וּמַת כֶּ֨סֶף֙ וּנְחֹ֔שֶׁת הֵבִ֕יאוּ אֵ֖ת תְּרוּמַ֣ת יְהוָ֑ה וְכֹ֡ל אֲשֶׁר֩ נִמְצָ֨א אִתּ֜וֹ עֲצֵ֥י שִׁטִּ֛ים לְכָל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת הָעֲבֹדָ֖ה הֵבִֽיאוּ׃
Translit: kol-mērîm tərūmath kesef ūnəḥōsheth hēvîʾū ʾēth tərūmath ʾadhōnāi vəkhōl ʾasher nimtṣāʾ ʾittō ʿatṣē shiṭṭîm ləkhol-məleʾkheth hāʿavōdhāh hēvîʾū
English: Every one that did offer an offering of silver and brass brought the LORD'S offering: and every man, with whom was found shittim wood for any work of the service, brought it.

Hebrew: וְכָל־אִשָּׁ֥ה חַכְמַת־לֵ֖ב בְּיָדֶ֣יהָ טָו֑וּ וַיָּבִ֣יאוּ מַטְוֶ֗ה אֶֽת־הַתְּכֵ֨לֶת֙ וְאֶת־הָֽאַרְגָּמָ֔ן אֶת־תּוֹלַ֥עַת הַשָּׁנִ֖י וְאֶת־הַשֵּֽׁשׁ׃
Translit: vəkhol-ʾisshāh ḥakhmath-lēv bəyādhehā ṭāvū vayyāvîʾū maṭveh ʾeth-hattəkhēleth vəʾeth-hāʾargāmān ʾeth-tōlaʿath hasshānî vəʾeth-hasshēsh
English: And all the women that were wise hearted did spin with their hands, and brought that which they had spun, both of blue, and of purple, and of scarlet, and of fine linen.

Hebrew: וְכָל־הַ֨נָּשִׁ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָשָׂ֥א לִבָּ֛ן אֹתָ֖נָה בְּחָכְמָ֑ה טָו֖וּ אֶת־הָעִזִּֽים׃
Translit: vəkhol-hannāshîm ʾasher nāsāʾ libbān ʾōthānāh bəḥokhmāh ṭāvū ʾeth-hāʿizzîm
English: And all the women whose heart stirred them up in wisdom spun goats' hair.

Hebrew: וְהַנְּשִׂאִ֣ם הֵבִ֔יאוּ אֵ֚ת אַבְנֵ֣י הַשֹּׁ֔הַם וְאֵ֖ת אַבְנֵ֣י הַמִּלֻּאִ֑ים לָאֵפ֖וֹד וְלַחֹֽשֶׁן׃
Translit: vəhannəsiʾim hēvîʾū ʾēth ʾavnē hasshōham vəʾēth ʾavnē hammilluʾîm lāʾēfōdh vəlaḥōshen
English: And the rulers brought onyx stones, and stones to be set, for the ephod, and for the breastplate;

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַבֹּ֖שֶׂם וְאֶת־הַשָּׁ֑מֶן לְמָא֕וֹר וּלְשֶׁ֨מֶן֙ הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה וְלִקְטֹ֖רֶת הַסַּמִּֽים׃
Translit: vəʾeth-habbōsem vəʾeth-hasshāmen ləmāʾōr ūləshemen hammishḥāh vəliqṭōreth hassammîm
English: And spice, and oil for the light, and for the anointing oil, and for the sweet incense.

Hebrew: כָּל־אִ֣ישׁ וְאִשָּׁ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָדַ֣ב לִבָּם֮ אֹתָם֒ לְהָבִיא֙ לְכָל־הַמְּלָאכָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהוָ֛ה לַעֲשׂ֖וֹת בְּיַד־מֹשֶׁ֑ה הֵבִ֧יאוּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל נְדָבָ֖ה לַיהוָֽה׃
Translit: kol-ʾîsh vəʾisshāh ʾasher nādhav libbām ʾōthām ləhāvîʾ ləkhol-hamməlāʾkhāh ʾasher tṣivvāh ʾadhōnāi laʿasōth bəyadh-mōsheh hēvîʾū vənē-yisrāʾēl nədhāvāh laʾdhōnāi
English: The children of Israel brought a willing offering unto the LORD, every man and woman, whose heart made them willing to bring for all manner of work, which the LORD had commanded to be made by the hand of Moses.

English: And Moses said unto the children of Israel, See, the LORD hath called by name Bezaleel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah;

English: And in the cutting of stones, to set them, and in carving of wood, to make any manner of cunning work.

English: And he hath put in his heart that he may teach, both he, and Aholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan.

Hebrew: מִלֵּ֨א אֹתָ֜ם חָכְמַת־לֵ֗ב לַעֲשׂוֹת֮ כָּל־מְלֶ֣אכֶת חָרָ֣שׁ וְחֹשֵׁב֒ וְרֹקֵ֞ם בַּתְּכֵ֣לֶת וּבָֽאַרְגָּמָ֗ן בְּתוֹלַ֧עַת הַשָּׁנִ֛י וּבַשֵּׁ֖שׁ וְאֹרֵ֑ג עֹשֵׂי֙ כָּל־מְלָאכָ֔ה וְחֹשְׁבֵ֖י מַחֲשָׁבֹֽת׃

English: Them hath he filled with wisdom of heart, to work all manner of work, of the engraver, and of the cunning workman, and of the embroiderer, in blue, and in purple, in scarlet, and in fine linen, and of the weaver, even of them that do any work, and of those that devise cunning work.

Hebrew: וְעָשָׂה֩ בְצַלְאֵ֨ל וְאָהֳלִיאָ֜ב וְכֹ֣ל אִ֣ישׁ חֲכַם־לֵ֗ב אֲשֶׁר֩ נָתַ֨ן יְהוָ֜ה חָכְמָ֤ה וּתְבוּנָה֙ בָּהֵ֔מָּה לָדַ֣עַת לַעֲשֹׂ֔ת אֶֽת־כָּל־מְלֶ֖אכֶת עֲבֹדַ֣ת הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ לְכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֖ה יְהוָֽה׃

English: Then wrought Bezaleel and Aholiab, and every wise hearted man, in whom the LORD put wisdom and understanding to know how to work all manner of work for the service of the sanctuary, according to all that the LORD had commanded.

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֣א מֹשֶׁ֗ה אֶל־בְּצַלְאֵ֘ל וְאֶל־אָֽהֳלִיאָב֒ וְאֶל֙ כָּל־אִ֣ישׁ חֲכַם־לֵ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָתַ֧ן יְהוָ֛ה חָכְמָ֖ה בְּלִבּ֑וֹ כֹּ֚ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר נְשָׂא֣וֹ לִבּ֔וֹ לְקָרְבָ֥ה אֶל־הַמְּלָאכָ֖ה לַעֲשֹׂ֥ת אֹתָֽהּ׃

English: And Moses called Bezaleel and Aholiab, and every wise hearted man, in whose heart the LORD had put wisdom, even every one whose heart stirred him up to come unto the work to do it:

English: And they received of Moses all the offering, which the children of Israel had brought for the work of the service of the sanctuary, to make it withal. And they brought yet unto him free offerings every morning.

English: And all the wise men, that wrought all the work of the sanctuary, came every man from his work which they made;

English: And they spake unto Moses, saying, The people bring much more than enough for the service of the work, which the LORD commanded to make.

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֣ו מֹשֶׁ֗ה וַיַּעֲבִ֨ירוּ ק֥וֹל בַּֽמַּחֲנֶה֮ לֵאמֹר֒ אִ֣ישׁ וְאִשָּׁ֗ה אַל־יַעֲשׂוּ־ע֛וֹד מְלָאכָ֖ה לִתְרוּמַ֣ת הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ וַיִּכָּלֵ֥א הָעָ֖ם מֵהָבִֽיא׃
Translit: vaytṣav mōsheh vayyaʿavîrū qōl bammaḥaneh lēʾmōr ʾîsh vəʾisshāh ʾal-yaʿasū-ʿōdh məlāʾkhāh lithrūmath haqqōdhesh vayyikkālēʾ hāʿām mēhāvîʾ
English: And Moses gave commandment, and they caused it to be proclaimed throughout the camp, saying, Let neither man nor woman make any more work for the offering of the sanctuary. So the people were restrained from bringing.

Hebrew: וְהַמְּלָאכָ֗ה הָיְתָ֥ה דַיָּ֛ם לְכָל־הַמְּלָאכָ֖ה לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת אֹתָ֑הּ וְהוֹתֵֽר׃
Translit: vəhamməlāʾkhāh hāyəthāh dhayyām ləkhol-hamməlāʾkhāh laʿasōth ʾōthāhh vəhōthēr
English: For the stuff they had was sufficient for all the work to make it, and too much.

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂ֨וּ כָל־חֲכַם־לֵ֜ב בְּעֹשֵׂ֧י הַמְּלָאכָ֛ה אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן עֶ֣שֶׂר יְרִיעֹ֑ת שֵׁ֣שׁ מָשְׁזָ֗ר וּתְכֵ֤לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָן֙ וְתוֹלַ֣עַת שָׁנִ֔י כְּרֻבִ֛ים מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה חֹשֵׁ֖ב עָשָׂ֥ה אֹתָֽם׃

English: And every wise hearted man among them that wrought the work of the tabernacle made ten curtains of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet: with cherubims of cunning work made he them.

Hebrew: אֹ֜רֶךְ הַיְרִיעָ֣ה הָֽאַחַ֗ת שְׁמֹנֶ֤ה וְעֶשְׂרִים֙ בָּֽאַמָּ֔ה וְרֹ֨חַב֙ אַרְבַּ֣ע בָּֽאַמָּ֔ה הַיְרִיעָ֖ה הָאֶחָ֑ת מִדָּ֥ה אַחַ֖ת לְכָל־הַיְרִיעֹֽת׃

English: The length of one curtain was twenty and eight cubits, and the breadth of one curtain four cubits: the curtains were all of one size.

Hebrew: וַיְחַבֵּר֙ אֶת־חֲמֵ֣שׁ הַיְרִיעֹ֔ת אַחַ֖ת אֶל־אֶחָ֑ת וְחָמֵ֤שׁ יְרִיעֹת֙ חִבַּ֔ר אַחַ֖ת אֶל־אֶחָֽת׃

English: Fifty loops made he in one curtain, and fifty loops made he in the edge of the curtain which was in the coupling of the second: the loops held one curtain to another.

English: And he made fifty taches of gold, and coupled the curtains one unto another with the taches: so it became one tabernacle.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַשׂ֙ יְרִיעֹ֣ת עִזִּ֔ים לְאֹ֖הֶל עַל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן עַשְׁתֵּֽי־עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה יְרִיעֹ֖ת עָשָׂ֥ה אֹתָֽם׃
Translit: vayyaʿas yərîʿōth ʿizzîm ləʾōhel ʿal-hammishkān ʿashtē-ʿesrēh yərîʿōth ʿāsāh ʾōthām
English: And he made curtains of goats' hair for the tent over the tabernacle: eleven curtains he made them.

Hebrew: אֹ֜רֶךְ הַיְרִיעָ֣ה הָאַחַ֗ת שְׁלֹשִׁים֙ בָּֽאַמָּ֔ה וְאַרְבַּ֣ע אַמּ֔וֹת רֹ֖חַב הַיְרִיעָ֣ה הָאֶחָ֑ת מִדָּ֣ה אַחַ֔ת לְעַשְׁתֵּ֥י עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה יְרִיעֹֽת׃
Translit: ʾōrekh hayrîʿāh hāʾaḥath shəlōshîm bāʾammāh vəʾarbaʿ ʾammōth rōḥav hayrîʿāh hāʾeḥāth middāh ʾaḥath ləʿashtē ʿesrēh yərîʿōth
English: The length of one curtain was thirty cubits, and four cubits was the breadth of one curtain: the eleven curtains were of one size.

Hebrew: וַיְחַבֵּ֛ר אֶת־חֲמֵ֥שׁ הַיְרִיעֹ֖ת לְבָ֑ד וְאֶת־שֵׁ֥שׁ הַיְרִיעֹ֖ת לְבָֽד׃
Translit: vayḥabbēr ʾeth-ḥamēsh hayrîʿōth ləvādh vəʾeth-shēsh hayrîʿōth ləvādh
English: And he coupled five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves.

Translit: vayyaʿas lulāʾōth ḥamisshîm ʿal səfath hayrîʿāh haqqîtṣōnāh bammaḥbāreth vaḥamisshîm lulāʾōth ʿāsāh ʿal-səfath hayrîʿāh haḥōvereth hasshēnîth
English: And he made fifty loops upon the uttermost edge of the curtain in the coupling, and fifty loops made he upon the edge of the curtain which coupleth the second.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֛עַשׂ קַרְסֵ֥י נְחֹ֖שֶׁת חֲמִשִּׁ֑ים לְחַבֵּ֥ר אֶת־הָאֹ֖הֶל לִֽהְיֹ֥ת אֶחָֽד׃
Translit: vayyaʿas qarsē nəḥōsheth ḥamisshîm ləḥabbēr ʾeth-hāʾōhel lihyōth ʾeḥādh
English: And he made fifty taches of brass to couple the tent together, that it might be one.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ מִכְסֶה֙ לָאֹ֔הֶל עֹרֹ֥ת אֵלִ֖ים מְאָדָּמִ֑ים וּמִכְסֵ֛ה עֹרֹ֥ת תְּחָשִׁ֖ים מִלְמָֽעְלָה׃
Translit: vayyaʿas mikhseh lāʾōhel ʿōrōth ʾēlîm məʾoddāmîm ūmikhsēh ʿōrōth təḥāshîm milmāʿəlāh
English: And he made a covering for the tent of rams' skins dyed red, and a covering of badgers' skins above that.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אֶת־הַקְּרָשִׁ֖ים לַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן עֲצֵ֥י שִׁטִּ֖ים עֹמְדִֽים׃
Translit: vayyaʿas ʾeth-haqqərāshîm lammishkān ʿatṣē shiṭṭîm ʿōmədhîm
English: And he made boards for the tabernacle of shittim wood, standing up.

Hebrew: עֶ֥שֶׂר אַמֹּ֖ת אֹ֣רֶךְ הַקָּ֑רֶשׁ וְאַמָּה֙ וַחֲצִ֣י הָֽאַמָּ֔ה רֹ֖חַב הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָֽד׃
Translit: ʿeser ʾammōth ʾōrekh haqqāresh vəʾammāh vaḥatṣî hāʾammāh rōḥav haqqeresh hāʾeḥādh
English: The length of a board was ten cubits, and the breadth of a board one cubit and a half.

Hebrew: שְׁתֵּ֣י יָדֹ֗ת לַקֶּ֨רֶשׁ֙ הָֽאֶחָ֔ד מְשֻׁלָּבֹ֔ת אַחַ֖ת אֶל־אֶחָ֑ת כֵּ֣ן עָשָׂ֔ה לְכֹ֖ל קַרְשֵׁ֥י הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
Translit: shətē yādhōth laqqeresh hāʾeḥādh məshullāvōth ʾaḥath ʾel-ʾeḥāth kēn ʿāsāh ləkhōl qarshē hammishkān
English: One board had two tenons, equally distant one from another: thus did he make for all the boards of the tabernacle.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אֶת־הַקְּרָשִׁ֖ים לַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן עֶשְׂרִ֣ים קְרָשִׁ֔ים לִפְאַ֖ת נֶ֥גֶב תֵּימָֽנָה׃
Translit: vayyaʿas ʾeth-haqqərāshîm lammishkān ʿesrîm qərāshîm lifʾath neghev tēmānāh
English: And he made boards for the tabernacle

Hebrew: וְאַרְבָּעִים֙ אַדְנֵי־כֶ֔סֶף עָשָׂ֕ה תַּ֖חַת עֶשְׂרִ֣ים הַקְּרָשִׁ֑ים שְׁנֵ֨י אֲדָנִ֜ים תַּֽחַת־הַקֶּ֤רֶשׁ הָאֶחָד֙ לִשְׁתֵּ֣י יְדֹתָ֔יו וּשְׁנֵ֧י אֲדָנִ֛ים תַּֽחַת־הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָ֖ד לִשְׁתֵּ֥י יְדֹתָֽיו׃
Translit: vəʾarbāʿîm ʾadhnē-khesef ʿāsāh taḥath ʿesrîm haqqərāshîm shənē ʾadhānîm taḥath-haqqeresh hāʾeḥādh lishtē yədhōthāv ūshənē ʾadhānîm taḥath-haqqeresh hāʾeḥādh lishtē yədhōthāv
English: And forty sockets of silver he made under the twenty boards; two sockets under one board for his two tenons, and two sockets under another board for his two tenons.

Hebrew: וּלְצֶ֧לַע הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ן הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית לִפְאַ֣ת צָפ֑וֹן עָשָׂ֖ה עֶשְׂרִ֥ים קְרָשִֽׁים׃
Translit: ūlətṣelaʿ hammishkān hasshēnîth lifʾath tṣāfōn ʿāsāh ʿesrîm qərāshîm
English: And for the other side of the tabernacle, which is toward the north corner, he made twenty boards,

Hebrew: וְאַרְבָּעִ֥ים אַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם כָּ֑סֶף שְׁנֵ֣י אֲדָנִ֗ים תַּ֚חַת הַקֶּ֣רֶשׁ הָאֶחָ֔ד וּשְׁנֵ֣י אֲדָנִ֔ים תַּ֖חַת הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָֽד׃
Translit: vəʾarbāʿîm ʾadhnēhem kāsef shənē ʾadhānîm taḥath haqqeresh hāʾeḥādh ūshənē ʾadhānîm taḥath haqqeresh hāʾeḥādh
English: And their forty sockets of silver; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.

Hebrew: וּֽלְיַרְכְּתֵ֥י הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן יָ֑מָּה עָשָׂ֖ה שִׁשָּׁ֥ה קְרָשִֽׁים׃
Translit: ūləyarkəthē hammishkān yāmmāh ʿāsāh shisshāh qərāshîm
English: And for the sides of the tabernacle westward he made six boards.

Hebrew: וּשְׁנֵ֤י קְרָשִׁים֙ עָשָׂ֔ה לִמְקֻצְעֹ֖ת הַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן בַּיַּרְכָתָֽיִם׃
Translit: ūshənē qərāshîm ʿāsāh limqutṣəʿōth hammishkān bayyarkhāthāyim
English: And two boards made he for the corners of the tabernacle in the two sides.

Hebrew: וְהָי֣וּ תוֹאֲמִם֮ מִלְּמַטָּה֒ וְיַחְדָּ֗ו יִהְי֤וּ תַמִּים֙ אֶל־רֹאשׁ֔וֹ אֶל־הַטַּבַּ֖עַת הָאֶחָ֑ת כֵּ֚ן עָשָׂ֣ה לִשְׁנֵיהֶ֔ם לִשְׁנֵ֖י הַמִּקְצֹעֹֽת׃
Translit: vəhāiū thōʾamim milləmaṭṭāh vəyaḥdāv yihyū thammîm ʾel-rōʾshō ʾel-haṭṭabbaʿath hāʾeḥāth kēn ʿāsāh lishnēhem lishnē hammiqtṣōʿōth
English: And they were coupled beneath, and coupled together at the head thereof, to one ring: thus he did to both of them in both the corners.

Hebrew: וְהָיוּ֙ שְׁמֹנָ֣ה קְרָשִׁ֔ים וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֣ם כֶּ֔סֶף שִׁשָּׁ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר אֲדָנִ֑ים שְׁנֵ֤י אֲדָנִים֙ שְׁנֵ֣י אֲדָנִ֔ים תַּ֖חַת הַקֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָאֶחָֽד׃
Translit: vəhāiū shəmōnāh qərāshîm vəʾadhnēhem kesef shisshāh ʿāsār ʾadhānîm shənē ʾadhānîm shənē ʾadhānîm taḥath haqqeresh hāʾeḥādh
English: And there were eight boards; and their sockets were sixteen sockets of silver, under every board two sockets.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ בְּרִיחֵ֖י עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים חֲמִשָּׁ֕ה לְקַרְשֵׁ֥י צֶֽלַע־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן הָאֶחָֽת׃
Translit: vayyaʿas bərîḥē ʿatṣē shiṭṭîm ḥamisshāh ləqarshē tṣelaʿ-hammishkān hāʾeḥāth
English: And he made bars of shittim wood; five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,

Hebrew: וַחֲמִשָּׁ֣ה בְרִיחִ֔ם לְקַרְשֵׁ֥י צֶֽלַע־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן הַשֵּׁנִ֑ית וַחֲמִשָּׁ֤ה בְרִיחִם֙ לְקַרְשֵׁ֣י הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן לַיַּרְכָתַ֖יִם יָֽמָּה׃
Translit: vaḥamisshāh vərîḥim ləqarshē tṣelaʿ-hammishkān hasshēnîth vaḥamisshāh vərîḥim ləqarshē hammishkān layyarkhāthayim yāmmāh
English: And five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the tabernacle for the sides westward.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַשׂ אֶת־הַבְּרִ֣יחַ הַתִּיכֹ֑ן לִבְרֹ֨חַ֙ בְּת֣וֹךְ הַקְּרָשִׁ֔ים מִן־הַקָּצֶ֖ה אֶל־הַקָּצֶֽה׃
Translit: vayyaʿas ʾeth-habbərîaḥ hattîkhōn livrōaḥ bəthōkh haqqərāshîm min-haqqātṣeh ʾel-haqqātṣeh
English: And he made the middle bar to shoot through the boards from the one end to the other.

Hebrew: וְֽאֶת־הַקְּרָשִׁ֞ים צִפָּ֣ה זָהָ֗ב וְאֶת־טַבְּעֹתָם֙ עָשָׂ֣ה זָהָ֔ב בָּתִּ֖ים לַבְּרִיחִ֑ם וַיְצַ֥ף אֶת־הַבְּרִיחִ֖ם זָהָֽב׃
Translit: vəʾeth-haqqərāshîm tṣippāh zāhāv vəʾeth-ṭabbəʿōthām ʿāsāh zāhāv bāttîm labbərîḥim vaytṣaf ʾeth-habbərîḥim zāhāv
English: And he overlaid the boards with gold, and made their rings of gold to be places for the bars, and overlaid the bars with gold.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַשׂ֙ אֶת־הַפָּרֹ֔כֶת תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֣שׁ מָשְׁזָ֑ר מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה חֹשֵׁ֛ב עָשָׂ֥ה אֹתָ֖הּ כְּרֻבִֽים׃
Translit: vayyaʿas ʾeth-happārōkheth təkhēleth vəʾargāmān vəthōlaʿath shānî vəshēsh moshzār maʿasēh ḥōshēv ʿāsāh ʾōthāhh kəruvîm
English: And he made a vail of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen: with cherubims made he it of cunning work.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ לָ֗הּ אַרְבָּעָה֙ עַמּוּדֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֔ים וַיְצַפֵּ֣ם זָהָ֔ב וָוֵיהֶ֖ם זָהָ֑ב וַיִּצֹ֣ק לָהֶ֔ם אַרְבָּעָ֖ה אַדְנֵי־כָֽסֶף׃
Translit: vayyaʿas lāhh ʾarbāʿāh ʿammūdhē shiṭṭîm vaytṣappēm zāhāv vāvēhem zāhāv vayyitṣōq lāhem ʾarbāʿāh ʾadhnē-khāsef
English: And he made thereunto four pillars of shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold: their hooks were of gold; and he cast for them four sockets of silver.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ מָסָךְ֙ לְפֶ֣תַח הָאֹ֔הֶל תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֣שׁ מָשְׁזָ֑ר מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה רֹקֵֽם׃
Translit: vayyaʿas māsākh ləfethaḥ hāʾōhel təkhēleth vəʾargāmān vəthōlaʿath shānî vəshēsh moshzār maʿasēh rōqēm
English: And he made an hanging for the tabernacle door of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, of needlework;

Hebrew: וְאֶת־עַמּוּדָ֤יו חֲמִשָּׁה֙ וְאֶת־וָ֣וֵיהֶ֔ם וְצִפָּ֧ה רָאשֵׁיהֶ֛ם וַחֲשֻׁקֵיהֶ֖ם זָהָ֑ב וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֥ם חֲמִשָּׁ֖ה נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
Translit: vəʾeth-ʿammūdhāv ḥamisshāh vəʾeth-vāvēhem vətṣippāh rāʾshēhem vaḥashuqēhem zāhāv vəʾadhnēhem ḥamisshāh nəḥōsheth
English: And the five pillars of it with their hooks: and he overlaid their chapiters and their fillets with gold: but their five sockets were of brass.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַשׂ בְּצַלְאֵ֛ל אֶת־הָאָרֹ֖ן עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים אַמָּתַ֨יִם וָחֵ֜צִי אָרְכּ֗וֹ וְאַמָּ֤ה וָחֵ֨צִי֙ רָחְבּ֔וֹ וְאַמָּ֥ה וָחֵ֖צִי קֹמָתֽוֹ׃
Translit: vayyaʿas bətṣalʾēl ʾeth-hāʾārōn ʿatṣē shiṭṭîm ʾammāthayim vāḥētṣî ʾorkō vəʾammāh vāḥētṣî roḥbō vəʾammāh vāḥētṣî qōmāthō
English: And Bezaleel made the ark of shittim wood: two cubits and a half was the length of it, and a cubit and a half the breadth of it, and a cubit and a half the height of it:

Hebrew: וַיְצַפֵּ֛הוּ זָהָ֥ב טָה֖וֹר מִבַּ֣יִת וּמִח֑וּץ וַיַּ֥עַשׂ ל֛וֹ זֵ֥ר זָהָ֖ב סָבִֽיב׃
Translit: vaytṣappēhū zāhāv ṭāhōr mibbayith ūmiḥūtṣ vayyaʿas lō zēr zāhāv sāvîv
English: And he overlaid it with pure gold within and without, and made a crown of gold to it round about.

Hebrew: וַיִּצֹ֣ק ל֗וֹ אַרְבַּע֙ טַבְּעֹ֣ת זָהָ֔ב עַ֖ל אַרְבַּ֣ע פַּעֲמֹתָ֑יו וּשְׁתֵּ֣י טַבָּעֹ֗ת עַל־צַלְעוֹ֙ הָֽאֶחָ֔ת וּשְׁתֵּי֙ טַבָּע֔וֹת עַל־צַלְע֖וֹ הַשֵּׁנִֽית׃
Translit: vayyitṣōq lō ʾarbaʿ ṭabbəʿōth zāhāv ʿal ʾarbaʿ paʿamōthāv ūshətē ṭabbāʿōth ʿal-tṣalʿō hāʾeḥāth ūshətē ṭabbāʿōth ʿal-tṣalʿō hasshēnîth
English: And he cast for it four rings of gold, to be set by the four corners of it; even two rings upon the one side of it, and two rings upon the other side of it.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ בַּדֵּ֖י עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים וַיְצַ֥ף אֹתָ֖ם זָהָֽב׃
Translit: vayyaʿas baddē ʿatṣē shiṭṭîm vaytṣaf ʾōthām zāhāv
English: And he made staves of shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold.

Hebrew: וַיָּבֵ֤א אֶת־הַבַּדִּים֙ בַּטַּבָּעֹ֔ת עַ֖ל צַלְעֹ֣ת הָאָרֹ֑ן לָשֵׂ֖את אֶת־הָאָרֹֽן׃
Translit: vayyāvēʾ ʾeth-habbaddîm baṭṭabbāʿōth ʿal tṣalʿōth hāʾārōn lāsēʾth ʾeth-hāʾārōn
English: And he put the staves into the rings by the sides of the ark, to bear the ark.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ כַּפֹּ֖רֶת זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר אַמָּתַ֤יִם וָחֵ֨צִי֙ אָרְכָּ֔הּ וְאַמָּ֥ה וָחֵ֖צִי רָחְבָּֽהּ׃
Translit: vayyaʿas kappōreth zāhāv ṭāhōr ʾammāthayim vāḥētṣî ʾorkāhh vəʾammāh vāḥētṣî roḥbāhh
English: And he made the mercy seat of pure gold: two cubits and a half was the length thereof, and one cubit and a half the breadth thereof.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֛עַשׂ שְׁנֵ֥י כְרֻבִ֖ים זָהָ֑ב מִקְשָׁה֙ עָשָׂ֣ה אֹתָ֔ם מִשְּׁנֵ֖י קְצ֥וֹת הַכַּפֹּֽרֶת׃
Translit: vayyaʿas shənē khəruvîm zāhāv miqshāh ʿāsāh ʾōthām misshənē qətṣōth hakkappōreth
English: And he made two cherubims of gold, beaten out of one piece made he them, on the two ends of the mercy seat;

Hebrew: כְּרוּב־אֶחָ֤ד מִקָּצָה֙ מִזֶּ֔ה וּכְרוּב־אֶחָ֥ד מִקָּצָ֖ה מִזֶּ֑ה מִן־הַכַּפֹּ֛רֶת עָשָׂ֥ה אֶת־הַכְּרֻבִ֖ים מִשְּׁנֵ֥י קצוותו קְצוֹתָֽיו
Translit: kərūv-ʾeḥādh miqqātṣāh mizzeh ūkhərūv-ʾeḥādh miqqātṣāh mizzeh min-hakkappōreth ʿāsāh ʾeth-hakkəruvîm misshənē qətṣōthāv
English: One cherub on the end on this side, and another cherub on the other end on that side: out of the mercy seat made he the cherubims on the two ends thereof.

English: And the cherubims spread out their wings on high, and covered with their wings over the mercy seat, with their faces one to another; even to the mercy seatward were the faces of the cherubims.

Translit: vayyaʿas ʾeth-hasshuləḥān ʿatṣē shiṭṭîm ʾammāthayim ʾorkō vəʾammāh roḥbō vəʾammāh vāḥētṣî qōmāthō
English: And he made the table of shittim wood: two cubits was the length thereof, and a cubit the breadth thereof, and a cubit and a half the height thereof:

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַשׂ ל֥וֹ מִסְגֶּ֛רֶת טֹ֖פַח סָבִ֑יב וַיַּ֧עַשׂ זֵר־זָהָ֛ב לְמִסְגַּרְתּ֖וֹ סָבִֽיב׃
Translit: vayyaʿas lō misgereth ṭōfaḥ sāvîv vayyaʿas zēr-zāhāv ləmisgartō sāvîv

Hebrew: וַיִּצֹ֣ק ל֔וֹ אַרְבַּ֖ע טַבְּעֹ֣ת זָהָ֑ב וַיִּתֵּן֙ אֶת־הַטַּבָּעֹ֔ת עַ֚ל אַרְבַּ֣ע הַפֵּאֹ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֖ר לְאַרְבַּ֥ע רַגְלָֽיו׃
Translit: vayyitṣōq lō ʾarbaʿ ṭabbəʿōth zāhāv vayyittēn ʾeth-haṭṭabbāʿōth ʿal ʾarbaʿ happēʾōth ʾasher ləʾarbaʿ raghlāv
English: And he cast for it four rings of gold, and put the rings upon the four corners that were in the four feet thereof.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ אֶת־הַבַּדִּים֙ עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֔ים וַיְצַ֥ף אֹתָ֖ם זָהָ֑ב לָשֵׂ֖את אֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָֽן׃
Translit: vayyaʿas ʾeth-habbaddîm ʿatṣē shiṭṭîm vaytṣaf ʾōthām zāhāv lāsēʾth ʾeth-hasshuləḥān
English: And he made the staves of shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold, to bear the table.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֜עַשׂ אֶֽת־הַכֵּלִ֣ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הַשֻּׁלְחָ֗ן אֶת־קְעָרֹתָ֤יו וְאֶת־כַּפֹּתָיו֙ וְאֵת֙ מְנַקִּיֹּתָ֔יו וְאֶת־הַקְּשָׂוֺ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֻסַּ֖ךְ בָּהֵ֑ן זָהָ֖ב טָהֽוֹר׃

English: And he made the vessels which were upon the table, his dishes, and his spoons, and his bowls, and his covers to cover withal, of pure gold.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אֶת־הַמְּנֹרָ֖ה זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר מִקְשָׁ֞ה עָשָׂ֤ה אֶת־הַמְּנֹרָה֙ יְרֵכָ֣הּ וְקָנָ֔הּ גְּבִיעֶ֛יהָ כַּפְתֹּרֶ֥יהָ וּפְרָחֶ֖יהָ מִמֶּ֥נָּה הָיֽוּ׃
Translit: vayyaʿas ʾeth-hammənōrāh zāhāv ṭāhōr miqshāh ʿāsāh ʾeth-hammənōrāh yərēkhāhh vəqānāhh gəvîʿehā kaftōrehā ūfərāḥehā mimmennāh hāiū
English: And he made the candlestick of pure gold: of beaten work made he the candlestick; his shaft, and his branch, his bowls, his knops, and his flowers, were of the same:

Hebrew: וְשִׁשָּׁ֣ה קָנִ֔ים יֹצְאִ֖ים מִצִּדֶּ֑יהָ שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה קְנֵ֣י מְנֹרָ֗ה מִצִּדָּהּ֙ הָֽאֶחָ֔ד וּשְׁלֹשָׁה֙ קְנֵ֣י מְנֹרָ֔ה מִצִּדָּ֖הּ הַשֵּׁנִֽי׃
Translit: vəshisshāh qānîm yōtṣəʾîm mitṣṣiddehā shəlōshāh qənē mənōrāh mitṣṣiddāhh hāʾeḥādh ūshəlōshāh qənē mənōrāh mitṣṣiddāhh hasshēnî
English: And six branches going out of the sides thereof; three branches of the candlestick out of the one side thereof, and three branches of the candlestick out of the other side thereof:

Translit: shəlōshāh ghəviʿîm məshuqqādhîm baqqāneh hāʾeḥādh kaftōr vāferaḥ ūshəlōshāh ghəviʿîm məshuqqādhîm bəqāneh ʾeḥādh kaftōr vāfāraḥ kēn ləshēsheth haqqānîm hayyōtṣəʾîm min-hammənōrāh
English: Three bowls made after the fashion of almonds in one branch, a knop and a flower; and three bowls made like almonds in another branch, a knop and a flower: so throughout the six branches going out of the candlestick.

Hebrew: וּבַמְּנֹרָ֖ה אַרְבָּעָ֣ה גְבִעִ֑ים מְשֻׁ֨קָּדִ֔ים כַּפְתֹּרֶ֖יהָ וּפְרָחֶֽיהָ׃
Translit: ūvammənōrāh ʾarbāʿāh ghəviʿîm məshuqqādhîm kaftōrehā ūfərāḥehā
English: And in the candlestick were four bowls made like almonds, his knops, and his flowers:

Hebrew: וְכַפְתֹּ֡ר תַּחַת֩ שְׁנֵ֨י הַקָּנִ֜ים מִמֶּ֗נָּה וְכַפְתֹּר֙ תַּ֣חַת שְׁנֵ֤י הַקָּנִים֙ מִמֶּ֔נָּה וְכַפְתֹּ֕ר תַּֽחַת־שְׁנֵ֥י הַקָּנִ֖ים מִמֶּ֑נָּה לְשֵׁ֨שֶׁת֙ הַקָּנִ֔ים הַיֹּצְאִ֖ים מִמֶּֽנָּה׃
Translit: vəkhaftōr taḥath shənē haqqānîm mimmennāh vəkhaftōr taḥath shənē haqqānîm mimmennāh vəkhaftōr taḥath-shənē haqqānîm mimmennāh ləshēsheth haqqānîm hayyōtṣəʾîm mimmennāh
English: And a knop under two branches of the same, and a knop under two branches of the same, and a knop under two branches of the same, according to the six branches going out of it.

Hebrew: כַּפְתֹּרֵיהֶ֥ם וּקְנֹתָ֖ם מִמֶּ֣נָּה הָי֑וּ כֻּלָּ֛הּ מִקְשָׁ֥ה אַחַ֖ת זָהָ֥ב טָהֽוֹר׃
Translit: kaftōrēhem ūqənōthām mimmennāh hāiū kullāhh miqshāh ʾaḥath zāhāv ṭāhōr
English: Their knops and their branches were of the same: all of it was one beaten work of pure gold.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אֶת־נֵרֹתֶ֖יהָ שִׁבְעָ֑ה וּמַלְקָחֶ֥יהָ וּמַחְתֹּתֶ֖יהָ זָהָ֥ב טָהֽוֹר׃
Translit: vayyaʿas ʾeth-nērōthehā shivʿāh ūmalqāḥehā ūmaḥtōthehā zāhāv ṭāhōr
English: And he made his seven lamps, and his snuffers, and his snuffdishes, of pure gold.

Hebrew: כִּכָּ֛ר זָהָ֥ב טָה֖וֹר עָשָׂ֣ה אֹתָ֑הּ וְאֵ֖ת כָּל־כֵּלֶֽיהָ׃
Translit: kikkār zāhāv ṭāhōr ʿāsāh ʾōthāhh vəʾēth kol-kēlehā
English: Of a talent of pure gold made he it, and all the vessels thereof.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֛עַשׂ אֶת־מִזְבַּ֥ח הַקְּטֹ֖רֶת עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים אַמָּ֣ה אָרְכּוֹ֩ וְאַמָּ֨ה רָחְבּ֜וֹ רָב֗וּעַ וְאַמָּתַ֨יִם֙ קֹֽמָת֔וֹ מִמֶּ֖נּוּ הָי֥וּ קַרְנֹתָֽיו׃
Translit: vayyaʿas ʾeth-mizbaḥ haqqəṭōreth ʿatṣē shiṭṭîm ʾammāh ʾorkō vəʾammāh roḥbō rāvūaʿ vəʾammāthayim qōmāthō mimmennū hāiū qarnōthāv
English: And he made the incense altar of shittim wood: the length of it was a cubit, and the breadth of it a cubit; it was foursquare; and two cubits was the height of it; the horns thereof were of the same.

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֨ף אֹת֜וֹ זָהָ֣ב טָה֗וֹר אֶת־גַּגּ֧וֹ וְאֶת־קִירֹתָ֛יו סָבִ֖יב וְאֶת־קַרְנֹתָ֑יו וַיַּ֥עַשׂ ל֛וֹ זֵ֥ר זָהָ֖ב סָבִֽיב׃
Translit: vaytṣaf ʾōthō zāhāv ṭāhōr ʾeth-gaggō vəʾeth-qîrōthāv sāvîv vəʾeth-qarnōthāv vayyaʿas lō zēr zāhāv sāvîv
English: And he overlaid it with pure gold, both the top of it, and the sides thereof round about, and the horns of it: also he made unto it a crown of gold round about.

Hebrew: וּשְׁתֵּי֩ טַבְּעֹ֨ת זָהָ֜ב עָֽשָׂה־ל֣וֹ מִתַּ֣חַת לְזֵר֗וֹ עַ֚ל שְׁתֵּ֣י צַלְעֹתָ֔יו עַ֖ל שְׁנֵ֣י צִדָּ֑יו לְבָתִּ֣ים לְבַדִּ֔ים לָשֵׂ֥את אֹת֖וֹ בָּהֶֽם׃
Translit: ūshətē ṭabbəʿōth zāhāv ʿāsāh-lō mittaḥath ləzērō ʿal shətē tṣalʿōthāv ʿal shənē tṣiddāv ləvāttîm ləvaddîm lāsēʾth ʾōthō bāhem
English: And he made two rings of gold for it under the crown thereof, by the two corners of it, upon the two sides thereof, to be places for the staves to bear it withal.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אֶת־הַבַּדִּ֖ים עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים וַיְצַ֥ף אֹתָ֖ם זָהָֽב׃
Translit: vayyaʿas ʾeth-habbaddîm ʿatṣē shiṭṭîm vaytṣaf ʾōthām zāhāv
English: And he made the staves of shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֜עַשׂ אֶת־שֶׁ֤מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה֙ קֹ֔דֶשׁ וְאֶת־קְטֹ֥רֶת הַסַּמִּ֖ים טָה֑וֹר מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה רֹקֵֽחַ׃
Translit: vayyaʿas ʾeth-shemen hammishḥāh qōdhesh vəʾeth-qəṭōreth hassammîm ṭāhōr maʿasēh rōqēaḥ
English: And he made the holy anointing oil, and the pure incense of sweet spices, according to the work of the apothecary.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֛עַשׂ אֶת־מִזְבַּ֥ח הָעֹלָ֖ה עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים חָמֵשׁ֩ אַמּ֨וֹת אָרְכּ֜וֹ וְחָֽמֵשׁ־אַמּ֤וֹת רָחְבּוֹ֙ רָב֔וּעַ וְשָׁלֹ֥שׁ אַמּ֖וֹת קֹמָתֽוֹ׃
Translit: vayyaʿas ʾeth-mizbaḥ hāʿōlāh ʿatṣē shiṭṭîm ḥāmēsh ʾammōth ʾorkō vəḥāmēsh-ʾammōth roḥbō rāvūaʿ vəshālōsh ʾammōth qōmāthō
English: And he made the altar of burnt offering of shittim wood: five cubits was the length thereof, and five cubits the breadth thereof; it was foursquare; and three cubits the height thereof.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ קַרְנֹתָ֗יו עַ֚ל אַרְבַּ֣ע פִּנֹּתָ֔יו מִמֶּ֖נּוּ הָי֣וּ קַרְנֹתָ֑יו וַיְצַ֥ף אֹת֖וֹ נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃

English: And he made the horns thereof on the four corners of it

Translit: vayyaʿas ʾeth-kol-kəlē hammizbēaḥ ʾeth-hassîrōth vəʾeth-hayyāʿîm vəʾeth-hammizrāqōth ʾeth-hammizlāghōth vəʾeth-hammaḥtōth kol-kēlāv ʿāsāh nəḥōsheth
English: And he made all the vessels of the altar, the pots, and the shovels, and the basons, and the fleshhooks, and the firepans: all the vessels thereof made he of brass.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ לַמִּזְבֵּ֨חַ֙ מִכְבָּ֔ר מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה רֶ֣שֶׁת נְחֹ֑שֶׁת תַּ֧חַת כַּרְכֻּבּ֛וֹ מִלְּמַ֖טָּה עַד־חֶצְיֽוֹ׃
Translit: vayyaʿas lammizbēaḥ mikhbār maʿasēh resheth nəḥōsheth taḥath karkubbō milləmaṭṭāh ʿadh-ḥetṣyō
English: And he made for the altar a brasen grate of network under the compass thereof beneath unto the midst of it.

Hebrew: וַיִּצֹ֞ק אַרְבַּ֧ע טַבָּעֹ֛ת בְּאַרְבַּ֥ע הַקְּצָוֺ֖ת לְמִכְבַּ֣ר הַנְּחֹ֑שֶׁת בָּתִּ֖ים לַבַּדִּֽים׃
Translit: vayyitṣōq ʾarbaʿ ṭabbāʿōth bəʾarbaʿ haqqətṣāvōth ləmikhbar hannəḥōsheth bāttîm labbaddîm
English: And he cast four rings for the four ends of the grate of brass, to be places for the staves.

Translit: vayyaʿas ʾeth-habbaddîm ʿatṣē shiṭṭîm vaytṣaf ʾōthām nəḥōsheth
English: And he made the staves of shittim wood, and overlaid them with brass.

Hebrew: וַיָּבֵ֨א אֶת־הַבַּדִּ֜ים בַּטַּבָּעֹ֗ת עַ֚ל צַלְעֹ֣ת הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ לָשֵׂ֥את אֹת֖וֹ בָּהֶ֑ם נְב֥וּב לֻחֹ֖ת עָשָׂ֥ה אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translit: vayyāvēʾ ʾeth-habbaddîm baṭṭabbāʿōth ʿal tṣalʿōth hammizbēaḥ lāsēʾth ʾōthō bāhem nəvūv luḥōth ʿāsāh ʾōthō
English: And he put the staves into the rings on the sides of the altar, to bear it withal; he made the altar hollow with boards.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֗עַשׂ אֵ֚ת הַכִּיּ֣וֹר נְחֹ֔שֶׁת וְאֵ֖ת כַּנּ֣וֹ נְחֹ֑שֶׁת בְּמַרְאֹת֙ הַצֹּ֣בְאֹ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֣ר צָֽבְא֔וּ פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translit: vayyaʿas ʾēth hakkiyyōr nəḥōsheth vəʾēth kannō nəḥōsheth bəmarʾōth hatṣṣōvəʾōth ʾasher tṣāvəʾū pethaḥ ʾōhel mōʿēdh
English: And he made the laver of brass, and the foot of it of brass, of the lookingglasses of the women assembling, which assembled at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַשׂ אֶת־הֶחָצֵ֑ר לִפְאַ֣ת נֶ֣גֶב תֵּימָ֗נָה קַלְעֵ֤י הֶֽחָצֵר֙ שֵׁ֣שׁ מָשְׁזָ֔ר מֵאָ֖ה בָּאַמָּֽה׃
Translit: vayyaʿas ʾeth-heḥātṣēr lifʾath neghev tēmānāh qalʿē heḥātṣēr shēsh moshzār mēʾāh bāʾammāh
English: And he made the court: on the south side southward the hangings of the court were of fine twined linen, an hundred cubits:

Hebrew: עַמּוּדֵיהֶ֣ם עֶשְׂרִ֔ים וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֥ם עֶשְׂרִ֖ים נְחֹ֑שֶׁת וָוֵ֧י הָעַמֻּדִ֛ים וַחֲשֻׁקֵיהֶ֖ם כָּֽסֶף׃
Translit: ʿammūdhēhem ʿesrîm vəʾadhnēhem ʿesrîm nəḥōsheth vāvē hāʿammudhîm vaḥashuqēhem kāsef
English: Their pillars were twenty, and their brasen sockets twenty; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver.

Hebrew: וְלִפְאַ֤ת צָפוֹן֙ מֵאָ֣ה בָֽאַמָּ֔ה עַמּוּדֵיהֶ֣ם עֶשְׂרִ֔ים וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֥ם עֶשְׂרִ֖ים נְחֹ֑שֶׁת וָוֵ֧י הָֽעַמּוּדִ֛ים וַחֲשֻׁקֵיהֶ֖ם כָּֽסֶף׃
Translit: vəlifʾath tṣāfōn mēʾāh vāʾammāh ʿammūdhēhem ʿesrîm vəʾadhnēhem ʿesrîm nəḥōsheth vāvē hāʿammūdhîm vaḥashuqēhem kāsef
English: And for the north side the hangings were an hundred cubits, their pillars were twenty, and their sockets of brass twenty; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets of silver.

Hebrew: וְלִפְאַת־יָ֗ם קְלָעִים֙ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים בָּֽאַמָּ֔ה עַמּוּדֵיהֶ֥ם עֲשָׂרָ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם עֲשָׂרָ֑ה וָוֵ֧י הָעַמֻּדִ֛ים וַחֲשׁוּקֵיהֶ֖ם כָּֽסֶף׃
Translit: vəlifʾath-yām qəlāʿîm ḥamisshîm bāʾammāh ʿammūdhēhem ʿasārāh vəʾadhnēhem ʿasārāh vāvē hāʿammudhîm vaḥashūqēhem kāsef
English: And for the west side were hangings of fifty cubits, their pillars ten, and their sockets ten; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets of silver.

Hebrew: וְלִפְאַ֛ת קֵ֥דְמָה מִזְרָ֖חָה חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים אַמָּֽה׃
Translit: vəlifʾath qēdhəmāh mizrāḥāh ḥamisshîm ʾammāh
English: And for the east side eastward fifty cubits.

Hebrew: קְלָעִ֛ים חֲמֵשׁ־עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה אַמָּ֖ה אֶל־הַכָּתֵ֑ף עַמּוּדֵיהֶ֣ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם שְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃
Translit: qəlāʿîm ḥamēsh-ʿesrēh ʾammāh ʾel-hakkāthēf ʿammūdhēhem shəlōshāh vəʾadhnēhem shəlōshāh
English: The hangings of the one side of the gate were fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three.

Hebrew: וְלַכָּתֵ֣ף הַשֵּׁנִ֗ית מִזֶּ֤ה וּמִזֶּה֙ לְשַׁ֣עַר הֶֽחָצֵ֔ר קְלָעִ֕ים חֲמֵ֥שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה אַמָּ֑ה עַמֻּדֵיהֶ֣ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֖ם שְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃
Translit: vəlakkāthēf hasshēnîth mizzeh ūmizzeh ləshaʿar heḥātṣēr qəlāʿîm ḥamēsh ʿesrēh ʾammāh ʿammudhēhem shəlōshāh vəʾadhnēhem shəlōshāh
English: And for the other side of the court gate, on this hand and that hand, were hangings of fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three.

Hebrew: כָּל־קַלְעֵ֧י הֶחָצֵ֛ר סָבִ֖יב שֵׁ֥שׁ מָשְׁזָֽר׃
Translit: kol-qalʿē heḥātṣēr sāvîv shēsh moshzār
English: All the hangings of the court round about were of fine twined linen.

Hebrew: וְהָאֲדָנִ֣ים לָֽעַמֻּדִים֮ נְחֹשֶׁת֒ וָוֵ֨י הָֽעַמּוּדִ֜ים וַחֲשׁוּקֵיהֶם֙ כֶּ֔סֶף וְצִפּ֥וּי רָאשֵׁיהֶ֖ם כָּ֑סֶף וְהֵם֙ מְחֻשָּׁקִ֣ים כֶּ֔סֶף כֹּ֖ל עַמֻּדֵ֥י הֶחָצֵֽר׃
Translit: vəhāʾadhānîm lāʿammudhîm nəḥōsheth vāvē hāʿammūdhîm vaḥashūqēhem kesef vətṣippūy rāʾshēhem kāsef vəhēm məḥusshāqîm kesef kōl ʿammudhē heḥātṣēr
English: And the sockets for the pillars were of brass

Hebrew: וּמָסַ֞ךְ שַׁ֤עַר הֶחָצֵר֙ מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה רֹקֵ֔ם תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֣שׁ מָשְׁזָ֑ר וְעֶשְׂרִ֤ים אַמָּה֙ אֹ֔רֶךְ וְקוֹמָ֤ה בְרֹ֨חַב֙ חָמֵ֣שׁ אַמּ֔וֹת לְעֻמַּ֖ת קַלְעֵ֥י הֶחָצֵֽר׃
Translit: ūmāsakh shaʿar heḥātṣēr maʿasēh rōqēm təkhēleth vəʾargāmān vəthōlaʿath shānî vəshēsh moshzār vəʿesrîm ʾammāh ʾōrekh vəqōmāh vərōḥav ḥāmēsh ʾammōth ləʿummath qalʿē heḥātṣēr
English: And the hanging for the gate of the court was needlework, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen: and twenty cubits was the length, and the height in the breadth was five cubits, answerable to the hangings of the court.

Hebrew: וְעַמֻּֽדֵיהֶם֙ אַרְבָּעָ֔ה וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֥ם אַרְבָּעָ֖ה נְחֹ֑שֶׁת וָוֵיהֶ֣ם כֶּ֔סֶף וְצִפּ֧וּי רָאשֵׁיהֶ֛ם וַחֲשֻׁקֵיהֶ֖ם כָּֽסֶף׃
Translit: vəʿammudhēhem ʾarbāʿāh vəʾadhnēhem ʾarbāʿāh nəḥōsheth vāvēhem kesef vətṣippūy rāʾshēhem vaḥashuqēhem kāsef
English: And their pillars were four, and their sockets of brass four; their hooks of silver, and the overlaying of their chapiters and their fillets of silver.

Hebrew: וְֽכָל־הַיְתֵדֹ֞ת לַמִּשְׁכָּ֧ן וְלֶחָצֵ֛ר סָבִ֖יב נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
Translit: vəkhol-haythēdhōth lammishkān vəleḥātṣēr sāvîv nəḥōsheth
English: And all the pins of the tabernacle, and of the court round about, were of brass.
